item.title: By: ben dov
item.dc:creator: ben dov
item.description:
"Anyone who has read my work in the Fundamentalist Project knows that I spent much time explaining how that term did not really perfectly characterize the Jews about whom I was writing."
So why does he keep using that term for Jews who happen to have a more rightist outlook than Dr. Heilman?

item.title: By: Arie Folger
item.dc:creator: Arie Folger
item.description:
<blockquote>Most Orthodox Jews have never really figured out their theology. In all events, as a social anthropologist, I look at what people do and infer their beliefs from what they do.</blockquote>
Would he therefore also disagree with the self avowed non belief of the Social Orthodox, and deduce beliefs from their actions?
